What do the statuses mean?

  • Active: Customers are opted-in in communications (email/sms).
  • Deleted: Customer are deleted from the list of customers.

What do the statuses mean?

  • Active: Vehicles are still using services from the shop.
  • Inactive: Vehicles are not with the shop anymore.

help.text: For “Property Value”: Some property value has a “Default” label. That means the property has no specified value for the industry, so its value is the default one which is generic.
This is the category you wish to change in the business information. Currently, we provide the ability to change 4 items.
By opting-in/opting-out you are turning off the Communication Type you selected.

What do the statuses mean?

  • Active: Pets are still using services from the shop.
  • Inactive: Pets are not with the shop anymore.

What do the statuses “On” and “Off” mean?

  • On: This means that the businesses in the list will have the billing alert splashpage displayed on their dashboard.
  • Off: This means that the businesses in the list will have the billing alert splashpage removed from their dashboard.

help.location: Update Request - Business - Business Status Update
help.text:
What do the statuses mean?

  • Unverified: Demandforce Network portal unclaimed by business.
  • Verified: Demandforce Network portal that has been claimed by the business.
  • Setup: Use this status when the customer is not ready to start sending communications.
  • Active: This will activate the business and enable any communications that are on.
  • Canceled: Use this status when a customer has canceled.
  • Suspended: This will inactivate the portal and remove it from all feeds.

What do the statuses mean?

IsTest: This business is a test account should not be included in Demandforce Syndication services.

IsIndex: This business is an real account and should be included in Demandforce Syndication services.
Usually if a Start Date is May 1st, that means the start time is May 1st, 00:00 am.
Usually if an Expiration Date is May 30th, that means the expiration time is May 30th, 23:00 pm, but not May 31th, 00:00 am.

Currently, we provide the ability to add the following types of Splash:

- Full-screen Splash, which will be displayed by itself, will be only be used after successful login,before Dashboard is displayed;

- Main Content Addition Splash, which will be displayed at the top of main content section of top-level Tabs.
Currently, Dashboard on D3 Portal is the only Tab to display Main Content Addition Splash.
'Administrator' always has the right of User Management. 'Limited User' always has NO rights of User Management
Usually if a Start Date is May 1st, that means the start time is May 1st, 00:00 am.
Usually if an Expiration Date is May 30th, that means the expiration time is May 30th, 23:00 pm, but not May 31th, 00:00 am.
The number is the total Business which have this system alert.
His/Her Salesforce ID. Fill in this item to synchronize his/her Salesforce account with business portal. It can be added later
In this file, the options 'FirstName', 'LastName' and 'Email' are required, 'Password' and 'SalesforceID' are optional.
The input OptionType number isn't defined in Dfcore Constants class!

What do the removal reasons mean?

  • Derogatory Language：The review is abusive. An abusive review or comment is one that makes personal attack,threatens, or harasses others, or uses profanity.
  • Mentioned By Name:The review mentions specific names of individuals or posts personal information in the review or comments in a manner that is inappropriate and/or unrelated to the performance of the rendered.
  • Not Current Customer：The review is not from a current patient/customer. A current patient/customer is one who has received services within the preceding 12 months.
  • Contains Inaccuracies:The review contains material falsehoods or inaccuracies.
  • End-User Request:The end-user (customer of an auto shop, patient of a dental office, client of a salon) is emailing or contacting us directly, asking us to remove their review that they posted from the Web.
